intro: Madhuca smitinandii, commonly known as the Smitinandii Mahua, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces edible seeds that are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays an important role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
